snippet: Mario Manningham’s indelible catch in the fourth quarter, when he hauled in a 38-yard pass on the left sideline with his feet close to the boundary, brought back memories of David Tyree in 2008.
abstract: New York Giants receiver Mario Manningham's indelible catch in the fourth quarter of the Super Bowl, hauling in a 38-yard pass just inches inbounds, begins an 88-yard drive for the winning touchdown against the New England Patriots; reception evokes memories of a similarly spectacular Giants catch in their 2008 Super Bowl upset of the Patriots.
lead_paragraph: Mario Manningham’s indelible catch in the fourth quarter, when he hauled in a 38-yard pass on the left sideline with his feet close to the boundary, brought back memories of David Tyree in 2008.

headline.seo: Super Bowl — Manningham’s Patience Is Rewarded in Critical Catch
headline.main: Manningham’s Patience Is Rewarded in Critical Catch
headline.print_headline: The Title Comes Back: Manningham Stays Patient, And on Big Play, Stays Inbounds
